p: Serological studies carried out at the time indicated that the majority of children in Baltimore had been infected with HRSV before 4 years of age. Similar investigations in diverse parts of the world indicated that the HRSV was associated with diseases of the lower respiratory tract [ 33]. Currently, HRSV is recognized as the viral agent more frequently related to cases of bronchiolitis and pneumonia during infancy and preschool age. About 95% of the children have the first HRSV infection in the first 2 years of life, and the peak incidence occurs in the first few months [ 3]. Approximately 40% of children develop symptoms of lower respiratory tract involvement during the first infection. Although reinfections are common during a lifetime, the clinical symptoms in older children and adults are less severe [ 55].
